plan: Plan to test multiple bidding strategies, including aggressive high bids to gain data on competitors' tendencies, low-range bids to learn behavior when 'outscored', and mid-range bids for balanced insight. Also, I will track bidding patterns and adapt: if competitors bid high, I will explore lower-end; if they bid lower, I'll test high bids. Furthermore, I will experiment with randomized bidding to create uncertainty, and sequential lowering or raising bids by small increments strategy.

Initially, I plan to make medium to high bids, in the range of $50 to $99 to gather data on my opponents' strategies. Then, based on the bidding behavior of Andy and Charles, I'll adapt my strategy. If they are consistently bidding low, I'll reduce my bids to slightly above their average for potential profits. If they bid high, I'll selectively bid high when my value is high and bid low otherwise. Periodically, I'll make aggressive high bids for observational purposes. This mix of strategic and aggressive bidding will optimize user profit in the long run.

I plan to experiment with a range of bids from high, medium, to low values to gauge competition and assess possible profit margins. I will first start with aggressive high bids for data collection. If unsuccessful or margins are thin, I will transition to conservative low bids, then to moderate bids based on the data and competition pattern. Through progressive learning and adjusting bid strategy, I aim to maximize profit in the long run without risking too much capital in the early stage.

Next, I plan to bid slightly higher than my value to test win probability. I'll also experiment with low-ball bids to observe competitor behavior. Finally, I will attempt moderate bids slightly lower than my value for balance.

Next, I'll test moderate bids around $40-$50, to gauge opponents' reactions and establish their bidding range. If values are high, I may risk higher bids occasionally. I'll also experiment with low bids when my values are low.

I'll start with high-risk bids near my maximum value. If unsuccessful, I'll progressively lower my bids, observing the competition. I aim to find a sweet spot where I can bid just enough to win, but not overpay. Continuous evaluation and adjustment of my strategy will be critical for maximizing profits.

Planning to test out aggressive high bids slightly above my value. Additionally, I'll vary with low-end bids to gather data on competitor behavior. Increasing or decreasing sequential bids also to be tested for long-term insights.

I'll implement variational bidding, placing lower bids when my values are low, and higher bids when values are high. Often, I'll bid slightly above the average of previous round bids to observe reactions. Random aggressive bids will also be tested occasionally for more insights.

Given the competition, I'll test a more variable strategy. I'll bid slightly below my value, maintaining a safety margin. I'll also experiment with average bids, observing trends. My goal is to find an optimal bid that secures a win without paying more than the prize value.
Next plan: test moderately high bids slightly above my value. Also aim for precise low bids to gather competitor behavior data. Finally, gradually increase/decrease sequential bids for data insights.

I'll adopt a reactive strategy, observing Andy and Charles' bids. Low value rounds will have low bids; high value rounds will see aggressive bidding. Random, risky high bids will be made occasionally for further insights into their patterns. Balance between risk and reward will be kept.

I'll maintain a cautious approach with a bid slightly below my given value. I'll also consider past trends, and bid strategically, balancing between a safe margin and profitability. Additionally, I'll observe other bidders' strategies for better planning. Adjustments will be made according to the competition pattern.

Next, I plan to experiment with a randomized bidding within lower half range of my value. Also, balancing with mid-range bids to assess competitors' tendencies while ensuring maintained maneuverability. This would entail flexible improvision based on observed patterns.

I plan to variate bids based on value and past results, bid higher during high value rounds and lower otherwise. Occasionally, I'll place aggressive high bids for data collecting and adjust to counter competitors' bidding range more accurately.

I plan to experiment with lower bids to observe competitors’ responses. Bidding below my value might allow me to secure the prize at a lower cost while preserving profit margin. I'll also track trends and bid strategically, adjusting my strategy based on learning curve.

Plan to enhance unpredictability, employing a blend of random bids, high-risk high bids exceeding my value slightly, and conservative bids lower than value to optimize profit. A keen observation of competitors' strategies, adjusting mine flexibly, remains crucial.

Next, I'll set bids significantly below value when value is low and test substantially high bids when value is high. I'll proportion bid amounts to the average of previous bids of Andy and Charles, adjusting occasionally with high-risk bids for new insights.

I plan to tighten the gap between my value and bid, bidding roughly $10-$15 below my value, depending on other bids. I'll pay closer attention to competitors' bids, aiming to secure the auction at the lowest possible price while preserving a good profit margin.

Next, I'll test cautious bids around half my value, aggressive high bids above my value, and randomized bids to gauge competition tactics. Observing competitors and adapting bid strategy accordingly is key to optimize profit.

I'll increase my bids when my value is high, mirroring my competitors' top bids while remaining cautious not to overbid. For low values, I'll place substantially low bids. An occasional aggressive high-risk bid will be utilized for strategic learning.

My strategy: Bid incrementally below my value, range between $10-$15. Observe competitors' trends while maintaining profit. Experiment with slightly higher bids occasionally, for learning and dealing with unpredictable competition. Adjust tactics based on auction results.

Plan to experiment with low, mid, high bids relative to value, and random bids for unpredictability. Keen observation of competitors, adaptive strategizing, and testing aggressive and cautious bids, aiming for long-term profit maximization.

Moving forward, I'll explore aggressive but calculated high bids when value is high and moderate bids when low. I'll continue observing competitors' range, adjusting accordingly. Experimentation with slightly above average bids with occasional surprise low/high bids will bring valuable insights.

Analyzing previous rounds, I'll explore a slightly riskier but still guarded strategy, bidding closer to my value, enjoying potential high gains. I'll also take into consideration the data gathered from competitors' bidding habits. Potential profitability depends on intelligent risk management and strategic bidding based on accurate data evaluation.

I will implement a randomized bidding strategy, targeting a range from half to full value. This increases unpredictability while also testing aggressive high bids. I will also actively adapt strategy based on competitors' tendencies for optimized profit maximization.

I'll increase my bids on higher value rounds while bidding moderately on lower value rounds. Occasionally, I'll position aggressive bids for data gathering. My strategy will adapt according to Andy and Charles' average bids and patterns previously observed.

Based on previous bids, I plan to bid near my value initially. I will then drop to a medium risk strategy, bidding $10-$15 below my value. Depending on results, I may test high-risk bids, basing my decisions on gathered data and competition patterns.

I plan to test range bids between my value and the previous second-highest bid, along with some aggressive high bids and conservative low bids. Randomization strategies will also be employed for uncertainty, adjusting flexibly by observing competitors' bidding trends.

I'll place aggressive bids occasionally on high value rounds for data purposes and bid moderately to low otherwise, learning from past bids of competitors. Amendments will be done in accordance with Andy and Charles' pattern.

I'll experiment with bidding closer to my value, allowing a $5-$10 margin, to observe the results. However, if trends suggest competitors often bid above value, I'll consider aggressive bidding around my value, to win higher stakes.

Intend to test middle to aggressive bids based on my value, keeping controlled risks. Use lower bids when competitors tend to bid high. Experiment within randomized bid ranges, adapting from observed competitor patterns, maintaining a balance between gaining insightful data and optimizing profit.

I'll adapt a dynamic bidding strategy, keeping high-risk high-value bids on high worth rounds, and cautious low bids on low worth ones. Learning from Andy's and Charles's patterns, I'll occasionally introduce unpredictably high or low bids to discover their responses.

In upcoming rounds, I'll adjust my bids to 70-85% of my value to control risk while maximizing profit. I'll observe competitor bidding patterns, adjust my strategy accordingly, and occasionally test aggressive or conservative bids to gather more data and adapt my strategy effectively.

I'll consider a diverse strategy mixing low, medium, and high bids, exploit randomized bidding for unpredictability, and adjust tactically in response to competition. I'll incorporate aggressive bids slightly above my value and conservative bids below it for optimal results and capitalize on trends.

Continuing to adapt, I'll place high-risk bets during high-value rounds and low bets during low-value rounds. Sporadic, unpredictable high or low bids will be introduced to observe Andy and Charles' reactions. The aim is to progressively refine my bidding strategy for maximum profit.

Moving ahead, my strategy will be to diversify bids, some slightly above or below my value, depending on round's value. I'll observe previous rounds, competitors bidding and adjust accordingly. Risk management will stay crucial to my strategy, and bid adjustments will be made considering potential profits.

Plan to pursue a mix strategy of moderate to aggressive high bids around or over my value, conservative bids below my value, and continued randomization for unpredictability. Keep adapting based on observed bidding patterns of competitors, aiming for maximum profit optimisation.

I'll focus on high-risk high returns strategy, placing aggressive bids during high-value rounds. Also, I will bid slightly above average during medium to lower value rounds, still incorporating unexpected low and high bids occasionally for further data analysis.

I'll diversify my bids, sometimes bidding at, below, or slightly above my value to test incisive strategy. Evaluating previous bidding, I'll optimize my profit by bidding closer to the second highest bid. Bids would adapt based on acquired data, competitors' patterns and past results.

Continuing to refine approach based on observation; employing a mix of low-risk bids under my value, randomized bids for unpredictability, and aggressive high bids when it's reasonable. Adapting strategy according to competition, aiming for long-term profit maximization.

I'll proceed cautiously with moderate bids on low-value rounds. I plan to bid aggressively only on high-value rounds. Also, I aim to test sporadically high or low bids to gain additional insights into Andy and Charles' responses.

Next, I plan to implement a flexible strategy by bidding around 70-90% of my value, which balances risk and reward. I'll observe opponents' behaviors and shift strategy considering changing trends. I'll occasionally test aggressive or conservative bids to gather data and adapt my strategy effectively.

Focus on low-end randomized bids, considering my value and previous highest bids; test with incremental high bids for data gathering; probe conservative bids below value for balance. Observe competitors' patterns, adapt strategies promptly, prioritize long-term profit optimization over immediatewins.

Plan to continue moderate bids in low-value rounds and aggressive bidding in high-value rounds. Vary bids between being slightly above average and high-risk to anticipate competitors' patterns. Test with occasional extreme bids to gain insights. Aim to undercut slightly to target just above second highest bids for maximizing profits.

I'll adapt a flexible bidding strategy. Bids will span from 70-90% of my value. High and low risk bidding will be tested occasionally. Observing competitors and adjusting based on market trend will guide my bidding decisions for maximum long-term profit.
